required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Proellex® (CDB-4124) in Premenopausal Women With Symptomatic Uterine Fibroids
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Three-arm, Parallel Design, Placebo-controlled, Randomized, Double-blind, Multicenter Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of Proellex® (CDB-4124) in the Treatment of Premenopausal Women With Symptomatic Uterine Fibroids

brief_summary.textblock: Premenopausal women with symptomatic uterine fibroids will be randomized to either Proellex 25mg or 50mg or placebo for one treatment cycle (four months). Safety and effectiveness between 50 mg versus placebo, and between 25mg and placebo will be analyzed.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects with documented uterine fibroids, screening UFS-QOL severity score of at least 40, and meeting other eligibility criteria will be enrolled in the study. Following screening and a pre-treatment endometrial biopsy, subjects will be assessed monthly for the four (4) month double-blinded treatment phase. The study duration is approximately six months, comprised of a one-month screening period, 4 month treatment period and one month follow-up period. Subjects' blood will be drawn in a fasting state to obtain the pre-dose trough (PK) levels of study drug at each study drug dosing/dispensation visit to determine the potential for drug accumulation.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Repros stopped the study for safety and FDA put the study on hold for safety.

primary_outcome.measure: To Determine the Efficacy of 50 mg Proellex® Versus Placebo in the Treatment of Subjects With Symptomatic Uterine Fibroids From Baseline to Month 4 as Determined by Scoring Changes in the Pictorial Blood Loss Assessment Chart (PBAC)

arm_group.description: 25 mg oral daily dose of Proellex
50 mg oral daily dose of Proellex

intervention.description: One 25 mg capsule of Proellex® and one placebo capsule orally daily for up to four months
Two 25 mg mg capsules of Proellex® orally daily for up to four months
Two placebo capsules orally daily for up to four months

facility.name: Women's Health Care at Frost Steet
The Woman's Hospital of Texas, Clinical Research Center

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Prior to publication, Investigator shall submit to the Sponsor a copy of any proposed publication. Sponsor shall have sixty (60) days to review the proposed publication for possible disclosure of Sponsor’s Confidential Information and, upon request of Sponsor, Investigator shall delete any of Sponsor’s Confidential Information or withhold submission of such publication to allow Sponsor to protect its intellectual property rights

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study was prematurely terminated for safety reasons (Proellex studies were put on clinical hold due to liver toxicity). Sponsor was unable to pay vendor, and was therefore not provided with any study data.
